item.title: A woman writes on a chalkboard as children recite Arabic at Madarasatul Hisbulrrahim Quranic school in Utako district on the first day of Ramadan in Abuja
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: A woman writes on a chalkboard as children recite Arabic at Madarasatul Hisbulrrahim Quranic school in Utako district on the first day of the holy month of Ramadan in Nigeria's capital Abuja August 1, 2011. Muslims around the world abstain from eating, drinking and conducting sexual relations from sunrise to sunset during Ramadan, the holiest month in the Islamic calendar. item.title: Unrest in Beirut
item.dc:creator: kh1242
item.content:encoded: 22 Oct 2012, Beirut, Lebanon --- epa03442679 Lebanese anti-riot soldiers stand guard behind barbed wire erected to protect the Lebanese Government Palace in Beirut, Lebanon, 22 October 2012. Media reports state that one person was killed and another wounded on 22 October when Lebanese troops clashed with unidentified gunmen in a mainly Sunni Muslim area in the capital Beirut, police said, in the latest flare-up of tensions in the country. The violence started on 21 October when hundreds of protesters tried to storm the government headquarters at the end of the funeral of an assassinated high intelligence official. EPA/NABIL MOUNZER --- Image by Â© NABIL MOUNZER/epa/Corbis
item.excerpt:encoded: Lebanese anti-riot soldiers protect the Lebanese Government Palace from protesters following the October 19 bomb blast. Photo by Â© NABIL MOUNZER/epa/Corbis.
